name: Close Protection Operative (Level 3)
summary: A structured introduction to close protection principles, focusing on awareness, planning, and professional conduct.
outcomes: Situational awareness and basic threat assessment
whoFor: Individuals seeking to enter the security sector or those developing foundational knowledge in close protection.
assessment: Short practical exercises and knowledge checks.
certification: A Level 3 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: Some learners may be eligible for external funding. Please contact us for guidance.

name: Hostile Environment Awareness (Level 3)
summary: Training designed to support safer decision-making and personal awareness in higher-risk environments.
outcomes: Make informed travel and planning decisions
whoFor: Learners who require baseline awareness training for higher-risk environments.
certification: A Level 3 award is provided on successful completion.
fundingNote: ELCAS funding may apply for eligible learners.

name: Event and Venue Safety Essentials (Level 2)
summary: Foundational training for individuals working in event and venue environments.
whoFor: Individuals new to event and venue environments.
assessment: Short written assessment and scenario discussion.
certification: A Level 2 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: External funding may be available in specific cases.

name: Spectator Safety (Level 2)
summary: A knowledge-based qualification for those working at public events and venues.
whoFor: Individuals working at public events and venues.
certification: A Level 2 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: Funding eligibility varies by employer or scheme.

name: Pit Barrier Operations (Level 2)
summary: Training covering safety awareness and responsibilities in front-of-stage environments.
whoFor: Personnel working at front-of-stage or barrier positions.
assessment: Short written assessment and operational discussion.
certification: A Level 2 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: Funding eligibility varies by employer or scheme.

name: Emergency Care for First Responders (Level 3)
summary: Practical training in first response principles for workplace and public settings.
whoFor: Individuals who may be first on scene during incidents.
assessment: Practical assessment and short written knowledge check.
certification: A Level 3 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: ELCAS funding may apply for eligible learners.

name: Risk Assessment in the Workplace (Level 3)
summary: Training focused on identifying hazards, assessing risk, and applying suitable controls.
whoFor: Supervisors and staff responsible for workplace safety.
assessment: Written assessment with practical planning tasks.
certification: A Level 3 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: ELCAS funding may apply for eligible learners.

name: Health and Safety for Supervisors (Level 4)
summary: A course designed to support supervisory responsibility for workplace safety.
whoFor: Supervisors and managers with responsibility for safety oversight.
assessment: Written assessment and workplace planning exercises.
certification: A Level 4 qualification is awarded on successful completion.
fundingNote: ELCAS funding may apply for eligible learners.
